body:
## Description

Create a simple input field with an autocomplete feature (when the user starts typing, after three characters a list of cities appear which matches that search). 

## Acceptance criteria

Check the items in the list below, as you are doing them:

- [ ] Create an organized website structure
    - `assets` (images, videos)
         - Should be in a separate folder. 
         - Their file names need to clearly indicate what they are.
         - Consider if you want some assets to also be organized in folders depending on the page they are used in.
    - `styles` (CSS files)
       - In a separate folder.
       - You will likely need a `global` css file that is used across all pages, and separate css files that are used only on a single page.
       - Read through [Organizing CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Organizing)
    - `scripts` (JS files)
       - In a separate folder.
       - You can have a single file, or multiple files
- [ ] Add a new `<input>` element to the DOM of your page.
    - At a minimum, it should work similarly to https://w3collective.com/autocomplete-search-javascript/ or https://gomakethings.com/creating-an-ajax-autocomplete-component-with-html-and-vanilla-js/,
    - Allowing you to select a city from a predefined list
    - Feel free to get more fancy, with nicer styling
- [ ] Instead of searching in a static, predefined list, integrate with a API that returns a list of cities, based on the first characters typed in the input. Examples of some services that offer city searching:
    - https://airhex.com/api/cities/
    - https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/places/web-service/autocomplete
    - https://apidocs.geoapify.com/playground/geocoding/#autocomplete
    - Note that most of the above services require you to obtain an API key
   

Note that you can also try using existing libraries, like https://github.com/tomickigrzegorz/autocomplete, https://github.com/TarekRaafat/autoComplete.js or even https://slimselectjs.com/ for this, but try to understand how they work.
title: City search box with autocomplete

body:
## Description

Create a card that shows the weather data (temperature, sky conditions, humidity, etc.) of the selected city. Searching and selecting a new city should update the card.


## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Select a weather API to use:
    - There are multiple APIs you can use for weather:
         - [WeatherApi](https://www.weatherapi.com/docs/)
         - [OpenWeatherMap](https://openweathermap.org/api)
         - [OpenMeteo](https://open-meteo.com/en)
         - And many other more, just search for "free weather API"
- [ ] When we search and select a city, the weather of this city is showing up. See https://freefrontend.com/css-weather-widgets for some UI/UX ideas.
- [ ] A way to access and view the forecast for the next five days.
- [ ] Weather panel is showing a fetch api spinner while the content is loading. See [Sample loading fetch API spinner on Codepen](https://codepen.io/wang0nya/pen/bzwQPr) or https://cssloaders.github.io/
title: Show weather data

body:
## Description

It would be nice to show an image that matches the city that the user has searched for. You can even go the extra mile and show a photo from the city, that also matches the current weather condition. For example, if the user searched for "Bucharest" and it's currently snowing in Bucharest, then show a picture of a snowy Bucharest.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ]  Assign a nice background image to the chosen city that fits nicely to the site and apply it on the background. You can create object which store city name and image url.
    -  You can use Pexels API to get image for chosen city dynamically. Read the official [Pexels API Documentation](https://www.pexels.com/api/documentation).
    - Generate a free API key from in order to access the Pexels API.
    - Use presented endpoint to get image for chosen city e.g. for Bucharest: https://api.pexels.com/v1/search?query=Bucharest
title: Show background image

body:
## Description

There is a button to put a city into the favorites, which list shows up when the input field is selected and the input is empty (the favorite list data doesn't need to persist after a reload, but the [LocalStorage API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/localStorage) could be used to persist the list)

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] A heart button exists next to the city name that saves it into a list
- [ ] The list of favorite cities is displayed below
- [ ] Selecting a city from the list automatically shows the weather in that location
title: Favorite places
